channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Wrightbus to boost Ballymena workforce by 300
item.description: As orders for zero-emission buses rise, the firms says 120 temporary jobs will also be made permanent.

item.title: Black Lives Matter: PSNI asks that protest fines be refunded
item.description: Police say they will make the request over more than 70 fines issued in Belfast and Derry last year.

item.title: Taxi firms in NI 'slaughtered with work' amid driver shortage
item.description: The number of registered taxi drivers in Northern Ireland fell by 809 in the past year.

item.title: Employment: Number on NI payrolls hits record high
item.description: For the second month in a row, employee numbers surpassed pre-Covid levels of March 2020.

item.title: Texas firm to create 153 jobs in Northern Ireland over four years
item.description: Economy Minister Gordon Lyons says the jobs will contribute £6.8m in wages to the local economy.

item.title: Long Covid: Health trust scheme helping staff get back to work
item.description: Monee Warwick returned to work as a children’s nurse six months after contracting Covid-19.

item.title: Bangor: Flagship Centre sold in multi-million pound deal
item.description: The once popular shopping site on Bangor's Main Street has been vacant since February 2019.

item.title: Afghanistan: 'You fear for your family and friends at home'
item.description: Four people with links to the island of Ireland speak of their fears for relatives amid the chaos.

item.title: Maghera: 'Crude but viable device' found in security alert
item.description: Police say the device was located in the Tirkane Road area of Maghera, County Londonderry, on Tuesday.

item.title: PSNI to alert 60 County Down schools of domestic abuse incidents
item.description: In a pilot scheme in County Down, police will tell schools if pupils are affected by violence at home.

item.title: Covid-19: Last chance for first jabs at NI's mass vaccination centres
item.description: The Big Jab Weekend campaign will see centres offering walk-in first jabs to the over-18s.

item.title: I'll retire if I don't win medal, says McKillop
item.description: Four-time Paralympic champion Michael McKillop says he is likely to retire if he does not win a medal at the upcoming Paralympics in Tokyo.

item.title: Afghanistan: NI soldier Capt Mark Hale died in vain, says wife
item.description: The wife of Capt Mark Hale says Western governments have left Afghan people "in the mouth of hell".

item.title: Mark Allen defeats former partner Reanne Evans at British Open
item.description: Mark Allen defeats former partner Reanne Evans 3-2 after surviving a major scare in the British Open.

item.title: West Belfast: Biggest ever Féile as NI welcomes back major crowds
item.description: Féile an Phobail director Kevin Gamble says this year's west Belfast festival was the largest ever.

item.title: Covid-19: Seven more deaths and 1,564 new cases
item.description: There are currently 392 patients with Covid in Northern Ireland's hospitals with 47 in intensive care.

item.title: Covid-19: Relaxation of NI self-isolation comes in effect
item.description: Fully-vaccinated close contacts of people who have Covid-19 do not need to self-isolate from Monday.

item.title: Covid-19: NI hospital patients and visitors urged to wear masks
item.description: Doctors report an increased number of people refusing to wear face coverings in healthcare settings.

item.title: What are Northern Ireland's Covid-19 rules now?
item.description: How do restrictions here compare to other parts of the UK and the Republic of Ireland?

item.title: Covid-19: Londonderry walk-in jab clinic for pregnant women opens
item.description: It is part of efforts to try to increase Northern Ireland's vaccination rate, amid rising coronavirus cases.

item.title: Covid-19: Where are Covid-19 vaccine clinics in NI?
item.description: Anyone aged 18 can now get a coronavirus jab at walk-in centres across Northern Ireland.

item.title: 'My sister's legacy is the Sibling Grief Club'
item.description: Sisters from County Tyrone started The Sibling Grief Club after their youngest sister died suddenly.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: The day firebombs devastated Ballymena
item.description: BBC NI's political correspondent Stephen Walker recalls his hometown on a dark day in 1976.

item.title: A brief history of vaccination in Northern Ireland
item.description: With debates over human rights and Covid-19, BBC News NI looks back to a time when jabs were compulsory.

item.title: Antiques Roadshow looking for hidden NI treasures
item.description: The BBC show is asking people to contact them if they have something of interest for their experts.

item.title: Fishing in Fermanagh: Reeling in young anglers by teaching new skills
item.description: Erne Anglers is offering lessons in the basics of fishing to youngsters in Enniskillen.

item.title: Afghanistan: 'You fear for your family and friends at home'
item.description: Muhammad Edrees, who lives in Londonderry, says he is fearful about his family back in Afghanistan.

item.title: Wrightbus 'firmly back in business' with 300 jobs
item.description: The Ballymena-based bus maker is hiring new staff and making another 120 posts permanent.

item.title: Gay and bisexual men give blood as Northern Ireland rules change
item.description: The Northern Ireland Blood Transfusion Service says the need for new donors has never been greater.

item.title: 'It's not just boys who can do it'
item.description: Girls take part in a summer scheme introducing them to careers traditionally viewed as jobs for men.

item.title: Londonderry bonfire: Police investigate 'offensive material'
item.description: Police say a bonfire had banners making threats towards police officers and a member of the public.

item.title: Fermanagh man faces nine indecent assault charges
item.description: Gerard Quaile, 56, is the second person to be charged following a newspaper investigation.

item.title: Londonderry: Teen taken to hospital after two assaults
item.description: Police say the 19-year-old was attacked twice in the Galliagh area after attending a bonfire.

item.title: Derry boss Ruaidhri Higgins praises players' belief after Jamie McGonigle penalty ends long winless run against Dundalk
item.description: Derry City secure a third consecutive Premier Division win as a Jamie McGonigle penalty gives them a 1-0 win over Dundalk at the Brandywell.

item.title: Jack Woolley: Irish Olympian awaiting surgery after Dublin attack
item.description: Irish Olympian Jack Woolley is awaiting surgery after being violently attacked in Dublin on Friday night.

item.title: Irish Paralympian's wheelchair broken on plane
item.description: Irish Para-swimmer Patrick Flanagan's wheelchair is left "completely broken" following a flight to Heathrow en route to the Tokyo Games.

item.title: Limerick: Pair held on suspicion of boy's murder freed
item.description: The four-year-old child was fatally injured in a house in Limerick on 13 March.

item.title: Gerry Hutch arrested in Spain over boxing weigh-in gun attack
item.description: Gerry Hutch, known as "The Monk", is wanted over the 2016 gun attack at the Regency Airport Hotel.

item.title: Climate change: Ireland getting warmer and wetter
item.description: The Status of Ireland Climate 2020 report also shows that sea levels around the coast are rising.
